attributes.action: Ban electric scooters from our pavements
attributes.additional_details: To police our pavements where possible to discourage and educate electric scooter users and to enforce the law. To enforce electric scooter users to wear crash helmets on our roads.
attributes.background: To make pavements and pedestrian walkways safe again for all; to protect our elderly and more vulnerable members of society. Although there are laws around the use of E-scooters, they are being driven on pavements illegally by many teenagers who show little consideration for pedestrians.

rejection.details:
As riding an electric scooter on a pavement is already illegal, it is unclear what further action or actions you would like the Government to take. You can find out more about this here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-48106617 and here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/e-scooter-trials-guidance-for-users#where-you-can-use-a-trial-e-scooter

You may wish to sign these petitions which call for related actions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581833
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586376
